description: Today's links Pluralistic is five: Blogging as a way of clawing back your attention. Hey look at this: Delights to delectate. Object permanence: 2005, 2010, 2015, 2020, 2024 Upcoming appearances: Where to find me. Recent appearances: Where I've been. Latest books: You keep readin' em, I'll keep writin' 'em. Upcoming books: Like I said, I'll keep writin' 'em. Colophon: All the rest. Pluralistic is five (permalink) Five years and two weeks ago, I parted ways with Boing Boing, a website I co-own and wrote for virtually every day for 19 years ago. Two weeks later – five years ago from today – I started my own blog, Pluralistic, which is, therefore, half a decade old, as of today. I've written an annual rumination on this most years since. Here's the fourth anniversary post (on blogging as a way to organize thoughts for big, ambitious, synthetic works): https://pluralistic.net/2024/02/20/fore/#synthesis The third (on writing without analytics): https://pluralistic.net/2023/02/
title: Pluralistic: Pluralistic is five (19 Feb 2025)
